Text.Page:
As a soldier, you understand that we don't leave our fallen behind. Every effort must be made to recover the dead, or at least their effects.

{@LinkCreature:418#2001#Baruster}'s got just such a mission in the {@Rgn:9018001$$Argon Catacombs} and asked for you personally.

All full-fledged members of the Shariar carry a ring into battle. It's a token, nothing more, but returning it to the families of the fallen might bring them some peace.

Search the catacombs for fallen Shariar and recover their rings for me, . From one soldier to another?

Excellent. I hope their families appreciate your efforts for our honored dead.

Certainly I do.

Please, take the rings to Agrakh at Zulfikar Fortress.

I know you'd rather be kicking ass and taking serial numbers, but how we honor our dead is at least as important as how we protect the living.

It's what separates us from the argons. Please, bring back those rings.

Excellent. I hope their families appreciate your efforts for our honored dead.

Certainly I do.

Please, take the rings to Agrakh at Zulfikar Fortress.

I know you'd rather be kicking ass and taking serial numbers, but how we honor our dead is at least as important as how we protect the living.

It's what separates us from the argons. Please, bring back those rings.

Excellent. I hope their families appreciate your efforts for our honored dead.

Certainly I do.

Please, take the rings to Agrakh at Zulfikar Fortress.

I know you'd rather be kicking ass and taking serial numbers, but how we honor our dead is at least as important as how we protect the living.

It's what separates us from the argons. Please, bring back those rings.
The Shariar are grateful for your help, <PCNAME>. When this war finally ends and we record the deeds of the fighters, your name will stand in a place of honor.
